elements.title: the northern­most mosque in the Western Hemisphere
elements.contents: ... that the northern­most mosque in the Western Hemisphere (pictured) was built in Winnipeg and shipped to Inuvik by barge and truck?

elements.title: Red Clay State Historic Park
elements.contents: ... that Red Clay State Historic Park was the last capital of the Cherokee Nation in the eastern United States?

elements.title: Otto Jäger
elements.contents: ... that in 1917, flying ace Otto Jäger was wounded by a propeller?

elements.title: The Clarion
elements.contents: ... that while seeking funding for The Clarion, Carrie Best was told by a donor: "You are just a small voice crying in the wilderness – but keep on crying"?

elements.title: Les Dés Sont Jetés
elements.contents: ... that when he saw the tapestry Les Dés Sont Jetés, Jørn Utzon exclaimed: "See that? Ours will be better!"?

elements.title: sponsored by alcohol companies
elements.contents: ... that while many Premier League clubs were sponsored by alcohol companies, no such sponsors remained by the 2017–18 season?

elements.title: Donald Gurnett
elements.contents: ... that plasma physicist Donald Gurnett was part of 41 NASA missions, including Voyager 1, for which he designed the instrument that confirmed that the craft had crossed the heliopause in 2012?

elements.title: Coleman's Melibe
elements.contents: ... that Coleman's Melibe is said to look like a "string of snot in the water"?
